pageProps.contentHtml:
measure theory, weak convergence

Let μ\muμ be a Borel probability measure on [0,1]\br{0, 1}[0,1] that has no atoms (this means that μ({t})=0\mu\p{\set{t}} = 0μ({t})=0 for any t∈[0,1]t \in \br{0, 1}t∈[0,1]). Let also μ1,μ2,…\mu_1, \mu_2, \ldotsμ1​,μ2​,… be Borel probability measures on [0,1]\br{0, 1}[0,1]. Assume that μn\mu_nμn​ converges to μ\muμ in the weak-* topology. Denote F(t)=μ([0,t])F\p{t} = \mu\p{\br{0, t}}F(t)=μ([0,t]) and Fn(t)=μn([0,t])F_n\p{t} = \mu_n\p{\br{0, t}}Fn​(t)=μn​([0,t]) for each n≥1n \geq 1n≥1 and t∈[0,1]t \in \br{0, 1}t∈[0,1]. Prove that FnF_nFn​ converges uniformly to FFF.
Solution.

Let {fn}n,{gn}n\set{f_n}_n, \set{g_n}_n{fn​}n​,{gn​}n​ be continuous functions such that fn≤χ[0,t]≤gnf_n \leq \chi_{\br{0,t}} \leq g_nfn​≤χ[0,t]​≤gn​ for all nnn and so that fnf_nfn​ increases to χ[0,t)\chi_{\pco{0,t}}χ[0,t)​ and gng_ngn​ decreases to χ[0,t]\chi_{\br{0,t}}χ[0,t]​ by taking piecewise linear functions. Then

∫fk dμn≤μn([0,t])≤∫fk dμ  ⟹  ∫fk dμ≤lim inf⁡n→∞μn([0,t])≤lim sup⁡n→∞μn([0,t])≤∫gk dμ,\begin{gathered} \int f_k \,\diff\mu_n \leq \mu_n\p{\br{0, t}} \leq \int f_k \,\diff\mu \\ \implies \int f_k \,\diff\mu \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{\br{0,t}} \leq \limsup_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{\br{0,t}} \leq \int g_k \,\diff\mu, \end{gathered}∫fk​dμn​≤μn​([0,t])≤∫fk​dμ⟹∫fk​dμ≤n→∞liminf​μn​([0,t])≤n→∞limsup​μn​([0,t])≤∫gk​dμ,​

by weak-* convergence. We can then apply monotone convergence on the left-most integral and dominated convergence on the right-most integral to get

μ([0,t))≤lim inf⁡n→∞μn([0,t])≤lim sup⁡n→∞μn([0,t])≤μ([0,t]).\mu\p{\pco{0, t}} \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{\br{0,t}} \leq \limsup_{n\to\infty} \mu_n\p{\br{0,t}} \leq \mu\p{\br{0, t}}.μ([0,t))≤n→∞liminf​μn​([0,t])≤n→∞limsup​μn​([0,t])≤μ([0,t]).

Since μ\muμ has no atoms, these are all equalities, so FnF_nFn​ converges pointwise to FFF. To prove pointwise convergence, let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. Since FFF is continuous, it is uniformly continuous, so let δ>0\delta > 0δ>0 be as in the definition of uniform continuity. Then by compactness, there exist 0=t0<t1<⋯<tN=10 = t_0 < t_1 < \cdots < t_N = 10=t0​<t1​<⋯<tN​=1 such that the B(ti,δ)B\p{t_i, \delta}B(ti​,δ) cover [0,1]\br{0, 1}[0,1]. By pointwise convergence, there exists M∈NM \in \NM∈N such that for n>Mn > Mn>M, ∣Fn(ti)−F(ti)∣<ε\abs{F_n\p{t_i} - F\p{t_i}} < \epsilon∣Fn​(ti​)−F(ti​)∣<ε for all 1≤i≤N1 \leq i \leq N1≤i≤N. Thus, given t∈[0,1]t \in \br{0, 1}t∈[0,1], there exists iii such that t∈[ti,ti+1]t \in \br{t_i, t_{i+1}}t∈[ti​,ti+1​], and so by monotonicity of every function,

∣Fn(t)−F(t)∣≤∣Fn(t)−Fn(ti)∣+∣Fn(ti)−F(ti)∣+∣F(ti)−F(t)∣≤Fn(t)−Fn(ti)+2ε≤Fn(ti+1)−Fn(ti)+(F(ti+1)−F(ti))+2ε≤∣Fn(ti+1)−F(ti+1)∣+∣Fn(ti)−F(ti)∣+2ε≤4ε,\begin{aligned} \abs{F_n\p{t} - F\p{t}} &\leq \abs{F_n\p{t} - F_n\p{t_i}} + \abs{F_n\p{t_i} - F\p{t_i}} + \abs{F\p{t_i} - F\p{t}} \\ &\leq F_n\p{t} - F_n\p{t_i} + 2\epsilon \\ &\leq F_n\p{t_{i+1}} - F_n\p{t_i} + \p{F\p{t_{i+1}} - F\p{t_i}} + 2\epsilon \\ &\leq \abs{F_n\p{t_{i+1}} - F\p{t_{i+1}}} + \abs{F_n\p{t_i} - F\p{t_i}} + 2\epsilon \\ &\leq 4\epsilon, \end{aligned}∣Fn​(t)−F(t)∣​≤∣Fn​(t)−Fn​(ti​)∣+∣Fn​(ti​)−F(ti​)∣+∣F(ti​)−F(t)∣≤Fn​(t)−Fn​(ti​)+2ε≤Fn​(ti+1​)−Fn​(ti​)+(F(ti+1​)−F(ti​))+2ε≤∣Fn​(ti+1​)−F(ti+1​)∣+∣Fn​(ti​)−F(ti​)∣+2ε≤4ε,​

so the convergence is uniform.
